page.title: 19Kingsley Holt Carnival
page.content: Monday 27 May 1985 The day of the Kingsley Holt carnival was wet, but the carnival still went on. People who were watching had macs and umbrellas; I wore my wellingtons. There were floats (covered in polythene to keep the rain out!) from Cheadle, Dilhorne, Ipstones, Kingsley and Kingsley Holt. Our Kingsley Holt float won second prize. The 12-year-old Kingsley Holt carnival queen was crowned, wearing a turquoise cloak. Her attendants wore pink dresses. There was a troupe of dancing girls, who got their suits very dirty. There were many sideshows on the muddy carnival field; a bottle stall, toy stalls and raffles. We won nothing, but I had 1 pound pocket money to spend. I had a 25p go on an inflatable bouncing castle, and bought a 20p ice-lolly.
